application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Details required for condition 23 (Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Evaluation) of planning permission 20/02235/FUL (Erection of 9-storey building comprising 41 self-contained residential units (12 x one-bedroom, 15 x two-bedroom and 14 x three-bedroom) (following demolition of existing garage units to rear of 1-44 Cumberland House;) with associated car parking, refuse and cycle storage and landscaping improvements to existing communal amenity space serving Cumberland House for use of existing and proposed residents)

decision_conditions: The applicant is informed that the submitted details specifically related to the Stage 1 Written Scheme of Investigation of Condition 23 (Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Evaluation) of planning permission 20/02235/FUL are considered acceptable.  As such Condition 23 of planning permission 20802235/FUL is hereby partially discharged.

Condition 5 ( Arboricultural Method Statement and  Tree Protection Plan) -  RBK Tree and Landscape Officer has  reviewed the submitted Arboricultural Method Statement and  Tree Protection Plan  prepared by Down to Earth Trees  dated 28 February 2025.   The applicant is informed that the submitted details are agreed and that  planning condition 5 (Arboricultural Method Statement and  Tree Protection Plan) of planning permission ref:  24/02828/HOU  (Demolition of an existing rear conservatory and erection of a single storey rear extension. Replacement of windows.) is hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with details hereby approved.

The submitted site plan and block plan do not have a scale bar.Please provide an Existing and Proposed Block Plan or Site Plan drawn at an identified standard metric scale (such as 1:200 or 1:500) with a scale bar showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site. The Block Plan must show the direction of North and should also show adjoining properties to the side and rear and those opposite in full outline.
